revised_title: Earthquake in St. Mary's Island and Observations on the Parallel Roads of Glen Roy
tldr: In 1839, an earthquake was felt in the Island of St. Mary's, one of the Scilly Islands. The tremors were slight and mainly felt in the island's southern parts. The earthquake was accompanied by a harsh and grating sound, but no significant agitation of the sea was observed. Additionally, a paper was partially read about the marine origin of the Parallel Roads of Glen Roy and other parts of Lochaber.
